text:
He laid his head on the dirty pillow. 

His heart raced. Thoughts swirled in chaos. 

“I need space,” he whispered. 

He grabbed his hat and stepped outside. 

No dread lingered. 

He walked toward Vassilyevsky Ostrov, 

muttering to himself. 

People stared, confused. 

“Is he drunk?” they wondered. 

He didn’t care. 

He needed to think.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling stifled and in turmoil, leaves his cramped room to walk aimlessly while muttering to himself.
